statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Marcus Keene drilled eight 3-pointers for 31 points and Central Michigan ran away from Arkansas-Pine Bluff in the second half to earn an 82-59 win on Saturday.
article.headline: Keene's 4th straight 30 point game paces Central Michigan
article.linkText: Keene's 4th straight 30 point game paces Central Michigan
article.story: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich. -- Marcus Keene drilled eight 3-pointers for 31 points and Central Michigan ran away from Arkansas-Pine Bluff in the second half to earn an 82-59 win on Saturday. It was Keene's fourth-straight game with 30-plus points, and his eight 3's ties him for fourth most in school history for a single game tying John Simons, Jeff Majerle and Tommie Johnson. Cecil Williams and Josh Kozinski each finished with 11 points for the Chippewas (7-2), with Williams adding eight rebounds. Central Michigan shot just 42.4 percent from the field made up for it with 15 3-pointers. Trent Steen scored 12 points with 12 boards for Arkansas-Pine Bluff (1-7). The score was tied at 39 at the half. But Central Michigan quickly took control, opening the second period on a 10-0 run. A Keene 3-pointer made it 66-51 with 7:20 to go, and the Golden Lions never threatened again.
